result.execSummary:
The defendant Semeca T Gray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bond amount posted shall be applied.

With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.   Court authorizes transfer to county jail convenient to employment or residence.

With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.  Court authorizes transfer to county jail convenient to employment or residence.

miscConds.notes: Bond amount posted shall be applied.  If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substance without a valid prescription and then take medication as prescribed.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with treatment recommendations.  

Defendant shall notify the probation agent within 48 hours of being prescribed medications.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.

Defendant shall pay any supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Semeca T Gray

Disposition Form

Def in person & by Atty Derek A Hawkins.  Atty Mark David Bensen appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Recess for counsel to clarify amendment and penalty.  Reconvene.  State withdraws the Amended Information and Court so orders. State moves to amend Count 1 to Misd. Possession of Prescription Drugs without a Valid Prescription-450.11(7)(h); Court grants amendment to Count 1.  Guilty plea entered to Count 1 as amended and Count 2 as charged.  Court finds def guilty on Count 1 as amended and Count 2 as charged and enters judgment.  Argument by counsel.  Court orders medical records be sealed.  Statements by defendant.
Medical Records submitted by defense on 3/22/16; Sealed per Order Sealing Documents dated 4/11/16
Letter received from Atty Hawkins
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 23, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Def in person & by Atty Derek A Hawkins.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  State indicates there was not a recommendation listed on the State's file.  Recess.  Recalled.  State files Amended Info and recommends on Count 1 a Withheld sentence and 3 years probation; Costs of $268.00; DNA sample and $250.00 surcharge; Counseling and treatment per agent; Maintain absolute sobriety; No controlled substance without a valid prescription; 6-9 months condition time and counsel free to argue.    Counsel request additional time to discuss the amendment with the defendant.  Not guilty plea entered to amended information. State does not grant amendment upon plea to a lesser charge and moves to withdraw the Amended Information, further statements by counsel.  Court permits the State to withdraw the Amended Information and does not accept the plea on the amended information.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 23, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Def in person & by Atty Derek A Hawkins.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  State moves to amend Count 1 to Dispensing prescription drug-450.11(1).  State agrees to recommend probation and condition time and states reason for requesting PSI.  Court does not feel a PSI is necessary.  State will file an information.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
